stories.text:
Big Search is a browser extension (Firefox+Chrome) to use / switch any one or multiple search engines. Source code on Github https://github.com/garywill/BigSearch .

Besides basic features, it is with some special technical features also.

For example, it works with those websites that don't provide GET/POST interface to public (so-called Ajax-only websites). Visitor need to open their page and input, then they show search results on page via Ajax. Big Search can turn such Ajax-only websites into search engines and add them to browser.

Chrome Extension API doc ( https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/ ) is one of such Ajax-only websites. That's a simple one. There're more such websites with more complicated js involved to do search, which still need us to figure out.

Big Search repo on Github : https://github.com/garywill/BigSearch
stories.title: Multi-search addon turning no-query-interface websites into search engines
Libre Space – creating open source space technologies

stories.text:
Hi HN, I’m looking for a short-depth rack server to run small, general-purpose workloads and experimentation. Probably not CPU-intensive. A bunch of Docker containers, some microservices, nginx, a small PostgreSQL instance, etc. 
It should be short-depth (< 15“) for a wall cabinet and of course run Linux well. Affordable would be great, but not looking for cheap. Any recommendations?
stories.title: Ask HN: Short-depth rack server for home lab recommendation
